title: Public opinion on the most important problem facing the U.S. 2020
summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership and lowest at Response Situation in Iraq/ISIS.
There is a difference of 26.0 between the maximum Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership and minimum Response Situation in Iraq/ISIS.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Share of respondents for 16 number of Responses.
Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership has the highest Share of respondents and Situation in Iraq/ISIS has the lowest Share of respondents.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership and lowest at Response Situation in Iraq/ISIS.
There is a difference of 26.0 between the maximum Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership and minimum Response Situation in Iraq/ISIS.
max_summary: This bar chart has 16 columns on the x axis representing Response, and Share of respondents in each Response on the y axis.
Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership has the highest Share of respondents and Situation in Iraq/ISIS has the lowest Share of respondents.
Second maximum Share of respondents is found at Response Healthcare.
The difference of Share of respondents between the highest and lowest Response is 26.0.

Response Dissatisfaction with government/Poor leadership is higher than any other Responses with value 28.0, followed by Healthcare, and Healthcare. Down to Response Situation in Iraq/ISIS with the lowest value 2.0.

Similar Share of respondents is found in Response Situation in Iraq/ISIS, Foreign policy/Foreign aid/Focus overseas, Economy in general, Guns/Gun control, Gap between rich and poor, Education, and Wars/War (nonspecific)/Fear of war.
The Response Situation in Iraq/ISIS tends to be 5.6 percent lower than average.
Summing up the values of all Responses, we get total 80.0.

data.Response: Lack of respect for each other
